Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expose IPackage instead of Package." (#1412) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
Obsolete `Package` property break [Clippit](https://github.com/sergey-tihon/Clippit/pull/63/files) library (ex OpenXmlPowerTools)

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1197905/232991966-03acf6c0-bd12-43ae-817c-ac454b7ebea1.png)


**To Reproduce**
Here is the branch with updated OpenXML version and all build errors - https://github.com/sergey-tihon/Clippit/pull/63/files

**Observed behavior**
No way to upgrade to `2.20.0`

**Expected behavior**
Exposed `IPackage`, mostly used for `GetParts()` and `GetPart()`

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Enable IDisposableFreature on part" (#1408) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Getting cell values is returning different format - OpenXML" (#1413) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
Getting cell value returns many decimal places. 

**Screenshots**
I have this "4.9" value in excel
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15882382/233115011-f9670d58-d641-427b-aee0-b85eb9f60344.png)

When retrieving the cell value in OpenXML. 4.9 was stored as 4.90000000000000000000004. It should return value as it was inputted.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15882382/233115315-e6777836-f800-487f-b40e-389be4b6cd2f.png)


**To Reproduce**
// Please add a self-contained, minimum viable repro of the issue.
// If you require external resources, please provide a gist or GitHub repro
// An Xunit style test is preferred, but a console application would work too.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Observed behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows]
 - Office version [e.g. 16.0.15427.20178]
 - .NET Target: (e.g. .NET Framework, .NET Core, UWP, Xamarin...)
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: (e.g. 2.11.0)

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
